Node.definition: = action by which humans supervise, direct or oversee work (such as building or repairing) or worship (such as singing or playing instruments)

= a flowering plant with an erect stem and long narrow leaves; it can grow to 1.5 m high; it has a bulbous root and cone shaped flowers, usually with 5 6 petals, which protrude straight out or slightly downward from the stem; ◄ Lilium candidum; ► associated with unsurpassed beauty
= man; ◄ son of Berechiah (בֶּרֶכְיָהוּ) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) ► temple singer; time of king David (דָּוִד)
= a type of song (שִׁיר) probably to be accompanied by musical instruments
= to make an effort to hear the words spoken by someone else

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

= group of small domestic animals traveling and feeding together; ◄ consisting of sheep and goats; ► hair or wool shorn for weaving into cloth; female milked for food; may be killed and eaten for meat; used as sacrificial animal; ≈ associated with large quantities and also with God's people, who are often seen as a flock with God as their shepherd
= man; ◄ eleventh son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and first son of Rachel (רָחֵל) ► father of Ephraim (אֶפְרַיִם) and Manasseh (מְנַשֶּׁה) each founder of a tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= action by which humans or deities assume a position of leadership, ◄ as if sitting on an actual throne
= heavenly creature with wings, ► carrying the throne of God, symbol of God's majesty, and associated with his presence
literally: to shine (forth); hence: = process by which a deity appears accompanied by a bright shining light
= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ son of Joseph (יֹוסֵף) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= man (called Ben Oni (בֶּן־אֹונִי) by his mother), tribe, and territory; ◄ twelfth and last son of Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and second son of Rachel (רָחֵל) ► founder of tribe of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
= man, tribe, and territory; ◄ son of Joseph (יֹוסֵף) ► founder of tribe of Manasseh (מְנַשֶּׁה)

Node.gloss: to rouse|to stir up|to raise|to stoke
Node.definition: = causative action by which someone causes an event to start taking place, ◄ as if it had been dormant or inactive for a certain time

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= the ability to accomplish great things because of characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the rescue or protection (of humans in need) implying success
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
literally: to bring back; hence: = causative action by which deities restore the well being of an indivual or group

Node.gloss: to cause to shine|to give light to|to light up|radiant|resplendent
Node.definition: = action that causes something to emit or to reflect light; ≈ associated with well being and wisdom
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the help of humans in need, whether in military, civil or judicial contexts
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

literally: YHWH (or one of the other names of God of a combination thereof) of Hosts; hence: = epithet of God with focus on his being in charge of the host of heavenly beings surrounding his throne, praising him, and carrying out his will in earth; ≈ as an epithet it relates to God's power and control of the cosmos as the divine king and warrior
particle linking an event to a point in time; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in time Y

= reference to an unknown point in time; ► normally used with the purpose of finding out which point in time is intended; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that this point of time may never arrive
literally: to smoke
= action by which humans speak to a deity, often by raising their hands, ► requesting help or expressing their thankfulness

Node.gloss: to make (someone) eat|to give (someone) to eat
Node.definition: = action by which someone gives other people food for consumption, sometimes with the added connotation that these people are actually forced to consume it; with or without explicit object
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general
= fluid appearing in the eye; ≈ primarily associated with grief and mourning
= fluid appearing in the eye; ≈ primarily associated with grief and mourning
= causative action by which humans or deities make objects or (other) humans different from what they were before
= state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons
= person who has a conflict with someone else and acts accordingly
only used in poetry; = action by which humans or deities express their disdain of others with words, sounds and/or gestures
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

literally: YHWH (or one of the other names of God of a combination thereof) of Hosts; hence: = epithet of God with focus on his being in charge of the host of heavenly beings surrounding his throne, praising him, and carrying out his will in earth; ≈ as an epithet it relates to God's power and control of the cosmos as the divine king and warrior
literally: to bring back; hence: = causative action by which deities restore the well being of an indivual or group

Node.gloss: to cause to shine|to give light to|to light up|radiant|resplendent
Node.definition: = action that causes something to emit or to reflect light; ≈ associated with well being and wisdom
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the help of humans in need, whether in military, civil or judicial contexts

= a creeping plant that develops a woody stem when it matures; it grows along the ground until it finds a tree or other object to climb, using tendrils (שָׂרִיג) ◄ vitis vinifera; ► it bears clusters (אֶשְׁכֹּל) of grapes (עֲנָב) that are sweet and juicy and can be made into wine (יַיִן) ≈ a symbol of blessing, prosperity, and happiness
= nation and their territory; ◄ regarded as founded by one of the sons of Ham (חָם) with the same name

Node.gloss: to pull out|to pull up|to uproot|to quarry
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans remove an object from another object into which it had been inserted or attached in a different way
= causative action by which people are expelled from their dwelling place

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural

= action of placing a seed or small plant in the ground so that it will grow and produce ≈ used symbolically to describe God's act of giving the people of Israel their own land, as promised to their ancestors
= a part of a plant normally below ground, which acts as a support and collects water and nourishment, ≈ associated with well being, offspring, and the inclination of the mind
= causative action by which someone causes a certain location, container, or surface to be filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= state or process by which a surface is covered by another object, ► often making this surface more or less invisible
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)

= evergreen tree growing up to 40 m tall, with a trunk up to 2.5 m in diameter; as it grows older its branches spread out more and more horizontally; grows in elevated places; ◄ Cedrus libani; ► highly appreciated building material; also used in cleaning ritual; ≈ associated with beauty, quality, pride, and strength
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth|= state of being impressive in size, evoking an association with God
literally: to send out one's branches or roots; hence: = causative action by which plants cause their branches or roots to grow and extend in a certain direction
particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y
literally: the sea; hence: = a large body of salt water located between Europe and Africa, west of Canaan/Israel
= large body of flowing water ◄ located in Mesopotamia
= young branch growing from the stump or stem of a tree or plant

Node.gloss: to break|to breach|to make breaches|to cut
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities make one or more large holes in a wall, hedge, or in the ground; ► with the purpose of entering through those holes or of making the area within it vulnerable; ≈ to have a town with a breached wall is also regarded as a deep humiliation

= a continuous vertical structure, usually made of natural stones, that encloses or divides an area of land; ≈ associated with security; in some cases used figuratively to denote integrity, which can be negatively affected by sin
= to remove fruits and other products from plants
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
exact meaning unknown; probably: = causative action by which wild animals cause damage to a cultivated area

= hairy mammal with hoofs, brown or gray in color; non ruminant and omnivorous; ◄ |iSus scropus|i*, wild or domesticated land animal; ► unclean animal and therefore not to be eaten; ≈ regarded as an ugly, filthy, and destructive animal and often associated with pagan rituals
= a large group of trees or shrubs which grow close together and where several wild animals are known to live; ≈ considered to be a dangerous place for humans and domestic animals
= collective term covering a variety of wild animals that move freely in the open field
= action by which animals are feeding on grass and other edible materials in the field, ≈ often extended to denote the way a king cares for his subjects or the way God cares for his people
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

literally: YHWH (or one of the other names of God of a combination thereof) of Hosts; hence: = epithet of God with focus on his being in charge of the host of heavenly beings surrounding his throne, praising him, and carrying out his will in earth; ≈ as an epithet it relates to God's power and control of the cosmos as the divine king and warrior
literally: to turn; hence: = action by which animals, humans, or deities move back to a location where they have been before

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

= the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

Node.gloss: to take notice|to be mindful (of someone, something)
Node.definition: = action by which deities or humans take notice of the misfortune or suffering of (other) humans, plants, or objects and intervene in order to help

= a creeping plant that develops a woody stem when it matures; it grows along the ground until it finds a tree or other object to climb, using tendrils (שָׂרִיג) ◄ vitis vinifera; ► it bears clusters (אֶשְׁכֹּל) of grapes (עֲנָב) that are sweet and juicy and can be made into wine (יַיִן) ≈ a symbol of blessing, prosperity, and happiness
exact meaning uncertain; probably: = the main branch of a vine
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

= action of placing a seed or small plant in the ground so that it will grow and produce ≈ used symbolically to describe God's act of giving the people of Israel their own land, as promised to their ancestors
= the side of the human body which is to the south when facing the direction of the rising sun
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

Node.gloss: to strengthen|to support|to repair|to let grow strong
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause inanimate objects or (other) humans to have physical, political, and/or military strength

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.
= causative action by which humans remove a relatively large plant or tree from its trunk with a sharp tool
= action by which humans or deities speak to animals, humans, deities, or natural objects in anger, in order to express their displeasure and cause them to change their behavior

Node.gloss: to vanish|to disappear|to be lost|to perish|to be broken|to be destroyed|to be ruined
Node.definition: = process by which humans or objects disappear or are removed from existence;◄ either by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, natural processes, acts of destruction, or direct divine intervention
literally: hand; hence: = action by which humans or deities exert strength and power
= the side of the human body which is to the south when facing the direction of the rising sun
= member of a larger group of related people or objects, ◄ referred to as a child of that larger group
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality

Node.gloss: to strengthen|to support|to repair|to let grow strong
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause inanimate objects or (other) humans to have physical, political, and/or military strength
= to cause to be healthy, strong, and/or prosperous
literally: name; hence: = the core of one's identity, which reflect the essence of one's being
literally: to call on (someone's) name; hence: = action by which humans acknowledge a deity and are willing to live in accordance with some of the requirements of that deity
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

literally: YHWH (or one of the other names of God of a combination thereof) of Hosts; hence: = epithet of God with focus on his being in charge of the host of heavenly beings surrounding his throne, praising him, and carrying out his will in earth; ≈ as an epithet it relates to God's power and control of the cosmos as the divine king and warrior
literally: to bring back; hence: = causative action by which deities restore the well being of an indivual or group

Node.gloss: to cause to shine|to give light to|to light up|radiant|resplendent
Node.definition: = action that causes something to emit or to reflect light; ≈ associated with well being and wisdom
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the help of humans in need, whether in military, civil or judicial contexts
